page.title: 11LANGUAGE Pentney & Narboro'
page.content:
{Ramblings in the norfolk dialect about {the Weather, Harvest and Thanksgiving:
Tha whather ha gan us orl tha blumen hump on our farm, we carn't git on wi' nurthen. Our marster dorn't know wot to find us ter do, and he ount stan us orf. We shall ha' tha harvest an tha sugarbeet pullen orl mixed up tergerther. We shull be a pullen a tha beet a tha mornen, and arter the corn in tha arternoon wen tha dew is orf. Tha marster say "I've never known a summer like this, but there yer are, that rained on St. Swiffen's so wot ken yer expect but as I say there allus wus a harvest, an there allus will be a harvest". We had our harvest Thanksgiven sarvice larst Tharsday nite. Th charch wus butefully decorated wi' corn, flowers, fruit an vegetables.
